bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.ab:
Consulate-General, U. S. A.,
Monrovia, Liberia, September 12, 1892

Mr William D. McCoy,
To the Department of State.
div1.p: Remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald, for subscription.

Inclosure
1. Letter containing remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald.
div1.ab:
Consulate-General, U. S. A.,
Monrovia, Liberia, September 12, 1892

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
div1.p: Inclosed please find letter containing a remittance ($5.00) to the New York Herald, for subscription.

A bill was sent to me but as it was not properly receipted I have requested that another one be sent to you, to be kept until I submit my Report for the Quarter, that it may be included in the contingent expenses for this Quarter.
As I have three Daily papers on my personal list I have requested that the Herald be discontinued that I may have the Weekly Tribune and London Times (Weekly) instead.
